intro: Acianthera phrynoglossa, commonly known as the horned orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble horns. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical rainforests. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive lip that is elongated and curled. Acianthera phrynoglossa is a terrestrial orchid that produces small, greenish leaves and has a symbiotic relationship with mycorrhizal fungi.
